entities.name: snape
entities.description: Snape is a character who has been spying and lying for someone to keep Lily Potter's son safe. He is shouting at Dumbledore, indicating his strong emotions towards the boy.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a character who is having a conversation with Snape. He seems to be concerned about Snape's feelings for Lily Potter's son.

entities.name: lily potter's son
entities.description: Lily Potter's son is the boy that Snape has been keeping safe. He is not explicitly named in this passage, but it can be inferred from the context.

entities.name: patronum
entities.description: Patronum is a spell that Snape casts to summon a magical creature to protect himself. It is not explicitly described in this passage, but it is mentioned as the name of the spell.

entities.name: silver doe
entities.description: The silver doe is a magical creature that Snape summons using the Patronum spell. It lands on the office floor, bounds across it, and flies out of the window.

relationships.description: Snape has been keeping Lily Potter's son safe, and it can be inferred that he has grown to care for the boy. This is evident from his strong emotions towards Dumbledore when he mentions raising him like a pig for slaughter.
Snape casts the Patronum spell to summon a magical creature to protect himself. This is evident from his shouting 'Expecto Patronum!' and the subsequent appearance of the silver doe.
Dumbledore seems to be concerned about Snape's feelings for Lily Potter's son. This is evident from his question 'Have you grown to care for the boy, after all?'
